intro: Dilepyrum multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered dilepyrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Dilepyrum multiflorum is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
